intro: Lappula besseyi, commonly known as Bessey's lappula, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
